conbody.p:
Datasets dedicated to input search contain the list of attributes to be presented in the search input. Each attribute becomes a possible criteria in the drop-down list, proposed in the generated page.
Attributes are displayed in a specific order that relies on an annotation; see section .

These datasets must respect certain design rules:
Dataset must be based on the entity to be searched. For instance, a dataset based on entity Instrument can be used in the instrument search only.
No association can be mapped on a search dataset, only attributes.
Several datasets for search can be created on the same based entity. For instance, you can specialize the search on instrument nature by creating several datasets, one by nature or group of nature.

You can extend such datasets with calculated attributes. You need then to create a special annotation on this attribute. This annotation contains the code interpreted at runtime and transformed into SQL request.
